div.p: Despite their desire to meet consumer demand, Premier must analyze the costs associated with this new equipment to determine if the benefits outweigh the costs in [link].

AlexCo produces collapsible wagons that are popular with beachgoers, shoppers, gardeners, parents and tailgaters. Annual sales have been 100,000 wagons per year. The retail selling price of each wagon is $67.00. To date, AlexCo has produced each of the components used in making the wagons but has been approached by DAL, Inc. with an offer to provide the axle and wheel assembly for $18.75 per assembly. AlexCo’s cost to produce the axle and wheel assembly are: $9.00 in direct materials, $6.50 in direct labor, $3.57 in variable overhead and $2.50 in fixed overhead. 25% of the fixed overhead is avoidable if the assembly is produced by DAL. Should AlexCo continue to make the axle and wheel assembly or should it buy the assembly from DAL, Inc.?
